page.title: 18EDUCATION
page.content: In a rural community like this thesize and pattern of the population is such that there are no schools in the survey area.Even at the primary level children must go to school in the villages like Great Sampford or Great Bardfield.More senior children go further afield as far as Saffron Walden or even Newport.This is true whether they attend local authority schools or fee-paying schools.There is a school bus service that is operated from Finchingfield;alternatively parents provide transport for their own and friends' children.Naturally, young people who continue with higher education at college or university must also travel or live away from home.The village schools provide a valuable social link between families who generally do not live in close proximity.
